snippet: Mrs. Clinton’s Senate victory was fueled by the unlikely support of white working-class voters there, but she faces new challenges in securing that kind of support again.
abstract: Hillary Clinton is looking to appeal to same white working-class voters in upstate New York who propelled her to victory in 2000 Senate race in order to defeat Sen Bernie Sanders in coming presidential primary; win is crucially important to Clinton both on personal level and as showcase of her ability to appeal to voters nationwide, particularly in face of Sanders's economic populism.

byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and THOMAS KAPLAN

lead_paragraph: Mrs. Clinton’s Senate victory was fueled by the unlikely support of white working-class voters there, but she faces new challenges in securing that kind of support again.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Again Looks Upstate for Win in New York
headline.print_headline: New York Region Poses Fresh Test for Clinton Bid
